Uses of Class
Entity

  • Uses of Entity in Unnamed Package

    Subclasses of Entity in Unnamed Package
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    Amoeba
    Represents an Amoeba entity in the game.
    class 
    AmoebaGroup
     
    class 
    BlueKey
    Represents a BlueKey that can be used to unlock BlueDoor objects.
    class 
    Boulder
    Represents a Boulder item in the game.
    class 
    Butterfly
     
    class 
    Enemy
    This Abstract Enemy class extends Entity and is intended to hold an abstract functions to find its future moves.
    class 
    Firefly
    The Firefly class represents a specific type of enemy with unique movement patterns.
    class 
    Frog
    This Frog class moves towards the player using A* algorithm and kills on touch
    class 
    Gem
    The Gem class represents a gem item that can be collected by the player.
    class 
    Goblin
    This Goblin class is a branch of Frog intended to steal diamonds from the player, then explode when they touch instead of killing the player.
    class 
    Item
    The Item class represents an entity that can fall and roll in the game.
    class 
    Key
     
    class 
    PathfindingEnemy
    Super for Frog and Goblin, uses A* to find the fastest path to the player.
    class 
    PatrollingEnemy
    Super for Butterfly and Firefly, uses Movement priority to find the next path to move to.
    class 
    PinkKey
    A class representing a pink key in the game.
    class 
    Player
     
    class 
    RedKey
    Represents a RedKey in the game, extending from the Key class.
    class 
    YellowKey
    Represents a yellow key in the application.
    Methods in Unnamed Package that return Entity
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Entity
    Map.getEntityAt(GridPosition coordinate)
    Returns the Entity at the provided coordinate.
    Entity
    Map.getEntityNeighbourOf(GameObject object, Direction direction)
    Returns the passed object's neighbouring Entities at the provided location, if one exists, null otherwise.
    Methods in Unnamed Package with parameters of type Entity
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    Map.destroyEntity(Entity entityToRemove)
    Removes the passed Entity from the Map.
